org.javascool.tools
Class Utils

java.lang.Object
  org.javascool.tools.Utils

public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object

This factory contains useful methods to interface javascool with the environment.

openURL

exec

public static java.lang.String exec(java.lang.String command,
                                    int timeout)
Runs an operating-system command, waits until completion and returns the output.

Parameters:
command - The operating systems command with its arguments separated by either tabulation ("\t" char) if any else space (" " char).
timeout - Timeout in second or 0 if no timeout. Default is 10.
Returns:
The command output (standard output and error output) including '\n'.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an I/O exception occurs during command execution.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the command returned status is non zero or if a time-out occurs.

exec

public static java.lang.String exec(java.lang.String command)

toUrl

public static java.net.URL toUrl(java.lang.String location)
Converts a location to a well-formed URL.

Parameters:
location - The location: either an URL or a local file-name or a ressource accessed by class code.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL is malformed.

loadString

public static java.lang.String loadString(java.lang.String location)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Loads an URL textual contents and returns it as a string.

Parameters:
location - A Universal Resource Location of the form:
http:/path-nameto load from a HTTP location
http:/path-name?param_i=value_i&..to get a form answer
ftp:/path-nameto load from a FTP site
file:/path-nameto load from a file
jar:/jar-path-name!/jar-entryto load from a JAR archive
(e.g.:jar:http://javascool.gforge.inria.fr/javascool.jar!/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL is malformed.
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an I/O exception has occurred.
java.io.IOException

saveString

public static void saveString(java.lang.String location,
                              java.lang.String string)
Saves a char-sequence in an URL textual contents.

Parameters:
location - @optional<"stdout:"> A Universal Resource Location of the form:
ftp:/path-nameto save onto a FTP site.
file:/path-nameto save into a file.
mailto:address?subject=subjectto send as an email in a readable form.
stdout:/to print to the terminal standard output.
string - The string to save.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL is malformed.
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an I/O exception has occurred.

getIcon

public static javax.swing.ImageIcon getIcon(java.lang.String location)
Returns an icon loaded from the applet context.

Parameters:
location - The icon file name, in the context directory (directory on the server or on the client side or in the jar) or as a URL.
Returns:
The related image icon or an empty icon if not loaded.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL is malformed.

play

public static void play(java.lang.String location)
Plays an audio clip (stop playing previous clip if the location is null).

Parameters:
location - A Universal Resource Location of the form:
http:/path-nameto load from a HTTP location
ftp:/path-nameto load from a FTP site
file:/path-nameto load from a file
jar:/jar-path-name!/jar-entryto load from a JAR archive
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception has occurred.

toName

public static java.lang.String toName(java.lang.String string)
Converts a string to proper name.

- A proper name is an identifier of lexical syntax: "[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*".

- The construct toName(string) == string allows to check that the string is a proper name.

Returns:
The string itself if it is a proper name, else a new string:
  • With punctuation replaced by '_'
  • With some symbols replaced by their Latin name
  • With French accents letter replaced by the corresponding unaccentuated letter
  • With other spurious char replaced by the string null

    toFileName

    public static java.lang.String toFileName(java.lang.String fileName,
                                          boolean extension)
    Converts a file-name to a location with a proper file-name.

    Parameters:
    fileName - The local fileName (not an URL) to be converted.
    extension - In false the extension is cancelled.
    Returns:
    A file: location with a proper name and separator-char.

    - System.out.println messages in French to the user if the file-name has to be changed.

    xml2xml

    public static java.lang.String xml2xml(java.lang.String xml,
                                       java.lang.String xsl)
                                throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
    Converts a XML string to another XML string using a XSL string.
    The saxon.jar must be in the path.

    Parameters:
    xml - The XML input string. If null simply cash the XSL.
    xsl - The XSL transformation string.
    Returns:
    The tranformed string.
    Throws:
    java.lang.RuntimeException - if an I/O exception has occurred.
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a syntax error has occurred.
    javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

    htm2xml

    public static java.lang.String htm2xml(java.lang.String htm)
    Converts a HTML string to a XHTML string.

    - Accentuation is re-encoded in UTF-*, spurious constructs (comments, instructions, ..) are deleted and empty tags are terminated by '/>'.

    - This is a fragible command in the sense that unexpected spurious or non-well formed HTML syntax may defeat it.

    Parameters:
    htm - The HTML string.
    Returns:
    The XHTML converted string.

    report

    public static java.lang.RuntimeException report(java.lang.Throwable error)
    Reports a throwable with the related context.

    Parameters:
    error - The error or exception to report.
    Returns:
    A RuntimeException encapsulation this error or exception, if it has to be rethrown.
